oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Larry Gatlin Live at the Westchester Theatre - 1979-11-24 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is from the Westchester Theatre live show. The tape features a live performance of Larry Gatlin (musician) and the Gatlin Brothers (musical group). The Lone Star Café show is presented by Mort Cooperman, Bill McGivney and the WHN radio network. The recording of Larry Gatlin is from November 24, 1979. The tape is part two of two.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Larry Gatlin; Gatlin Brothers
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Larry Gatlin praises Columbia Records -- (00:47) I've Done Enough Dyin' Today (Larry Gatlin and the Gatlin Brothers) -- (04:44) All the Gold in California (Larry Gatlin and the Gatlin Brothers) -- (07:40) Larry Gatlin praises meeting Bruce Lundvall -- (08:55) All the Gold in California (Larry Gatlin and the Gatlin Brothers) -- (10:33) Larry Gatlin reflects on the bible -- (12:39) Midnight Choir (Larry Gatlin and the Gatlin Brothers) -- (16:41) Midnight Choir (Larry Gatlin and the Gatlin Brothers) -- (17:25) Larry Gatlin reflects on integrity and asks for compassion -- (19:25) If Practice Makes Perfect (Larry Gatlin and the Gatlin Brothers) -- (20:42) I Just Wish You Were Someone I Love (Larry Gatlin and the Gatlin Brothers) -- (23:08) Don't Blame Me for Colorado (Larry Gatlin and the Gatlin Brothers) -- (26:42) Larry Gatlin introduces the band to be praised and asks for a doctor -- (30:15) Larry Gatlin recalls a time in Reno, Nevada -- (31:29) Alleluia (Larry Gatlin and the Gatlin Brothers) -- (33:11) Larry Gatlin says goodbye and Lee Arnold invites him back on stage -- (37:12) Sweet Becky Walker (Larry Gatlin and the Gatlin Brothers) -- (40:00) Larry Gatlin reflects on the idea of location changing people -- (42:32) Country Musings (Larry Gatlin and the Gatlin Brothers) -- (48:12) Lee Arnold gives his appreciation to the Gatlin Brothers and the various WHN contributors
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Gatlin Brothers; Gatlin, Larry; Gatlin, Larry, 1948-;
